message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.GT, cs.RO

The paper proposes a novel method for learning how to play Atari games using deep reinforcement learning, which falls under the category of machine learning. Specifically, the paper focuses on using human checkpoint replay to improve exploration strategies in games with sparse rewards. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CV (Computer Vision) since the proposed method involves using convolutional neural networks to estimate the state value function from raw pixel inputs. The paper also discusses the challenges of exploration in games, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.GT (Game Theory). Finally, the paper proposes a method for training deep reinforcement learning agents using human gameplay experience, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.RO (Robotics and Control).
